name: Happy Pi Day Pie! Make a Pi-Shaped Pie
description: There is some disagreement over when to celebrate Pie Day. Some (including the American Pie Council) cite January 23 as the day, the reason allegedly being that the digits of 1/23 are "easy as pie." Others (generally math nerds) say it must be March 14, or "Pi" Day. Of course, this is a very silly argument, because really, it's an opportunity to enjoy pie on two separate occasions.
recipeIngredient: 1 egg, beaten, to use as an egg wash

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 425°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
On the bottom half of your rolled dough, place your filling in the shape of a Pi symbol (you can use this template).
Fold the top half of the dough on top of your Pi-shaped filling.

Cut the dough around the filling to match the Pi shape, but leave a little extra dough around the sides of the filling so that you'll have a spot to pinch the edges so that the filling doesn't come out while baking.
You'll notice at this point that you have plenty of extra dough. I have just two words for you: Pie Fries.
Lightly brush with your egg wash, and place in the preheated oven. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until golden.
